channel.title: Posts on Jared DeHaan's Github Site
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Jared DeHaan's Github Site

item.title: Is Kofi Cockburn ready for the NBA or should he go back to Illinois for one more season?
item.description: Illinois had a terrific season thanks to future first round pick Ayo Dosunmu and Kofi Cockburn. Yes, I know this name sounds very funny but it’s pronounced like Coburn with no c and k.

item.title: Who was the worst college basketball team this season?
item.description: The constant questions you see are who is the best team in a particular season or who is the best player or players. I want to do a different spin and see who was the worst team(s) during the 2020-2021 NCAA basketball season. This Covid stricken season was very odd and many teams had difficulty playing all their games due to cancellations and postponements. Many teams found it difficult to find any rhythm and it showed for teams on the lower end of their respective conference standings.

item.title: Cleaning up Text
item.description: library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.0 ── ## ✓ ggplot2 3.3.3 ✓ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✓ tibble 3.0.5 ✓ dplyr 1.0.3 ## ✓ tidyr 1.1.2 ✓ stringr 1.4.0 ## ✓ readr 1.4.0 ✓ forcats 0.5.0 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## x dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() saved the badfootballlogs19.csv to a new dataframe called fbstats. fbstats <- read_csv("badfootballlogs19.csv") ## ## ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── ## cols( ## .

item.title: Illinois missed their chance
item.description: Illinois was a heavy favorite to win the 2021 NCAA Basketball National Championship but instead got ousted by the NCAA powerhouse Loyola Chicago in the Round of 32. I will be digging deep into stats to discover exactly why Illinois exited the tournament earlier than expected. I first loaded four libraries that I might need for my data into my project. library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.

item.title: About
item.description: Hey my name is Jared DeHaan. I am a sophomore Sports Media major at the University of Nebraska Lincoln. I am currently a peer mentor in the College of Journalism and will be a New Student Enrollment Orientation Leader this summer at UNL. I come from a small rural community in northeast Missouri and my family raises sheep on a small farm.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.
